content.raw: Got it, thanks for the link.
@nkoenig is there a reason to use a `std::shared_ptr` here instead of directly storing the object?
content.html: @nkoenig is there a reason to use a std::shared_ptr here instead of directly storing the object?

content.raw: Good point, I'll add a comment on the line where it is still used

see Nate's comment in the previous PR

content.raw: Just curious, why did the pimpl need to go? Because of the template?
content.html: Just curious, why did the pimpl need to go? Because of the template?

content.raw: Just a note that `std::unique_ptr` were removed but there are still `std::shared_ptr` in the file.
content.html: Just a note that std::unique_ptr were removed but there are still std::shared_ptr in the file.
